introduction: Allium moly, also known as yellow garlic,[4] golden garlic and lily leek, Is a species of flowering plant in the genus Allium, which also includes the flowering and culinary onions and garlic. A bulbous herbaceous perennial from the Mediterranean.[5][6] It is edible and used as a medicinal and ornamental plant.[7][8] Allium moly is a bulb type flower, with the size of the bulb affecting the flowering period and the time of the flowering.[9]
